summary: Is there a new episode of 'Love Island USA' on tonight, June 5? Find out when Season 7, Episode 3, of the hit reality series will be available to stream!
story: And the drama continues.
After Peacock debuted Season 7 of "Love Island USA" on Tuesday, June 3, fans have been eagerly waiting for each new episode to drop.

In Episode 2, the show abruptly announced the exit of contestant Yulissa Escobar. Little detail was given about her departure. “Yulissa has left the villa," series narrator Iain Stirling said in the series.

Escobar's departure comes after she received online backlash for using racist language in resurfaced clips of a podcast. Peacock confirmed to TODAY.com that Escobar is no longer a part of the show. The reality star has yet to publicly comment on her departure.
On the show, Escobar coupled up with fellow contestant Ace Green, even though he was already paired up with Chelley Bissainthe. This caused Chelley and Austin Shepard to couple up instead.
In a cast video that "Love Island USA" shared on Instagram, Escobar said she's ready to meet her match on the program.
“I’m here to find my knight in shining armor. I want that movie kind of love,” she said.
“I could be fire, so don’t play with fire because you might get burned, baby,” she added. “I’m here to have fun, to meet friends and enjoy summer in Fiji. We’re in Fiji!”
Episode 3 is set to be released soon. Scroll below to see how you can watch the new episode of "Love Island USA."
Is there a new episode of ‘Love Island USA’ on tonight, June 5?
Yes, there is!
Season 7, Episode 3, of "Love Island USA" will be available to stream tonight on Peacock at 6 p.m. PT/9 p.m. ET, so get your popcorn ready.
See the episode schedule here. Please also note that Peacock has yet to share an end date for the series.

title: A Member of Elliot Stabler's Family Died in His Arms on 'Organized Crime': What Happened
summary: Elliot Stabler (Chris Meloni)'s brother Joe Jr. (Michael Trotter) dies in his arms in the Season Five, Episode Nine "Law & Order: Organized Crime" episode.
story: The theme of loss for Elliot Stabler (Chris Meloni) on this season of “Law & Order: Organized Crime” continues to run deep — this time, hitting too close to home.
In the penultimate episode of Season Five, “Off the Books,” Stabler’s work life again overlaps with his personal one when his younger brother, Joe Jr. (Michael Trotter), returns to town.

Hints of Joe’s presence popped up throughout the season when the family’s matriarch, Bernadette “Bernie” Stabler (Ellen Burstyn), said he would call her. The eldest Stabler brother, Randall (Dean Norris), was also secretly working with Stabler’s police intelligence colleague Kyle Vargas (Tate Ellington) to track down Joe, whom the family hadn’t seen since he disappeared with a group of very dangerous men he got caught up with in the Season Four finale.
That crime group, led by Julian Emery (Tom Payne), resurfaces in this episode, and Joe, back in New York City after months overseas, learns the hard way what happens if he betrays Emery’s trust.
The episode kicks off with a frazzled Stabler still in the hospital, where Bernie was being treated for a heart issue, reacting after the phone call with Joe that ended last week’s episode.
“No matter what happens, know that I love you,” Joe told him.
Stabler assures his daughter Kathleen (Allison Siko) “everything is fine” and that her uncle is “in a situation that he’s just got to get himself out of and figure out.”

That situation for Joe continues to get more complicated when Emery kills a man who broke his trust during a business deal in front of him to send a message. The boss tells Joe to clean up his mess and make it look like “a robbery gone bad.” Emery then discloses to another associate that he knows Joe has a brother in the NYPD, while Joe trashes the place. Joe, who at the end of last season essentially agreed to be a confidential informant for his brother, makes sure to leave behind a drug packaging with the crime group’s signature marker, something one of Stabler’s police friends, Detective Tim McKenna (Jason Patric), eventually finds at the crime scene and shows him.
Meanwhile, Randall asks Kathleen where her father is and she tries to deflect, but Randall knows she’s lying. Kathleen tells him Joe called Stabler.

Joe again calls Stabler to tip him off to an upcoming drug deal at a warehouse involving Emery and a Turkish drug distributor, but after he hangs up, the camera pans to reveal Emery was listening in, so something isn’t right.
Stabler and his team raid the warehouse and apprehend the Turkish distributor, but Emery, not surprisingly, is not there.
Randall later shows up at Stabler’s office and confronts his brother about shutting him out of the latest with Joe.
“It’s called business, Randall,” Stabler says.
“It’s not business, it’s family! This is our family, all right?” Randall says before bringing up their mother.
“She’s not going to find out!” Stabler responds.
Randall asks what is going on with Joe, to which Stabler says he’s “trying to figure it out.”
Randall says he’s getting “premonitions.”
“It’s dark, Elliot,” he says. “It’s really dark. Something bad’s going to happen to Joe.”
Stabler tells him Joe is in New York, but he doesn’t know “what side of the street” their brother is working.
When Randall asks how he can help, Stabler tells him to watch their mom’s phone for a call from Joe.
Joe does call Bernie’s phone, and Randall picks up, telling him to reach out to Stabler. Joe tells Randall to have Stabler meet him at their “spot.”
Joe meets up with Stabler and tells him he worries too much before hugging his brother, saying he’s been clean for six months.
When Stabler asks why Emery wasn’t at the raid, Joe says, “He got spooked,” and couldn’t give his brother a heads-up because Emery is always at his side.
Stabler says the lifestyle suits Joe “maybe a little too much.”
“That’s what you think of me? I’m still just a f---up?” Joe says.
“I didn’t say that, Joey,” Stabler says.
When Joe asks if he’s a rat, Stabler tells him not to get it “twisted” and that he never wanted him caught up in this business.

After more back and forth, Joe tells Stabler how Emery plans to move massive amounts of drugs and where the exchange will go down. Joe even swears when asked on their mother’s life that he is telling the truth.
Before they go their separate ways, Stabler gives Joe a necklace he says is from their mom.
“Come home. When it’s over with, come home,” Stabler tells him.
On the way to the location, Emery notices Joe’s new necklace. Joe says it’s a St. Christopher medal.
“My brother gave it to me when we met up,” Joe tells him. “Mom wants me to have it.”

Emery’s associate informs them a cop caravan is coming their way. Emery realizes Joe’s new necklace, which appears to be the same necklace Stabler got earlier this season from a young victim who died on his watch, has a tracking device in it.
Emery takes Joe, leading Stabler on a chase, and holds him at gunpoint. He calls Stabler and tells him to remove the APB on him, to which Stabler says he’ll work on it.
“Sounds like it’s already too late,” Emery says as he hears sirens and helicopters.
Stabler hangs up and hears a gunshot. He tracks down his wounded brother, who is slumped against a wall and bleeding after being shot.
“I nailed it,” Joe tells his brother, in a last effort to seek his approval after helping lead the police to Emery, who again manages to escape.
Stabler holds Joe in his arms as Joe asks him to tell their mother he was clean.
“You tell her yourself,” Stabler says to Joe, as he asks him to stay with him.
As Joe takes a turn for the worse, Stabler rests his forehead against his brother’s and starts sobbing, pulling him closer after he dies.
Stabler later breaks the news to Randall.
The episode concludes with Stabler meeting up with McKenna, who has Emery’s associate tied up in the trunk of a car.
“Emery’s muscle,” McKenna says. “Caught him fleeing the shootout, and I was going to book him. Then I heard about your brother. So, we can take him in, or we can go for a ride.”
“Let’s go for a ride,” Stabler responds.
The season finale of "Law & Order: Organized Crime" will be released Thursday, June 12, on Peacock.
(Peacock is part of our parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: How Does ‘Ginny & Georgia’ Season 3 End? The Stars Unpack the Finale’s Shocking Twist
summary: What happened in the Season 3 finale of Ginny and Georgia? The stars explain the finale and what it means for Georgia to be pregnant.
story: Warning: This post contains spoilers for “Ginny & Georgia” Season 3.

When Georgia Miller turns herself in during “Ginny & Georgia” Season 3, it feels like the end of the road. But Netflix’s hit dramedy delivers a final episode that flips everything on its head — again. The real twist? Georgia’s actually pregnant. Or, at least, could be.

In this last episode, she’s back home, free from jail, but her new reality is more dangerous than ever. Her son, Austin (Diesel La Torraca), lied under oath to keep her out of prison. Her husband, Paul (Scott Porter), just walked out for good. And now, her estranged mother and stepfather — long out of the picture — have tracked her down. The final scene doesn’t feel like closure. It feels like the start of a war.
More on ‘Ginny & Georgia’
What to Remember From ‘Ginny & Georgia’ Season 2‘Ginny & Georgia’ Season 3: What Creators Say About the Show’s FutureEveryone Georgia Has Killed In ‘Ginny & Georgia’ — So Far
What to Remember From ‘Ginny & Georgia’ Season 2
‘Ginny & Georgia’ Season 3: What Creators Say About the Show’s Future
Everyone Georgia Has Killed In ‘Ginny & Georgia’ — So Far
In an interview with TODAY.com, stars Brianne Howey, who plays Georgia, and Antonia Gentry, who plays Ginny, reflect on the jaw-dropping finale — and what it means for their characters next.
What Happens at the End of ‘Ginny & Georgia’ Season 3?
“We’ve been calling this Georgia’s breakdown season,” Howey tells TODAY.com. “She got very burned this season — but she’s also resilient.”

That resilience is tested in new ways in “Ginny & Georgia” Season 3. After facing jail time for the death of Cynthia’s (Sabrina Grdevich) husband, Tom, Georgia ends the season a free woman. But just when it looks like things might finally settle — despite her enemies multiplying — the final moments reveal Georgia may be pregnant.
“We’re hoping to see her rise from the ashes,” Howey adds. “But the stakes just got so much higher.”
Earlier in the season, Georgia lied about a pregnancy to manipulate Paul into showing up to court. Paul suspects the child is not his, and when he learns the truth, he leaves her.

So now that Georgia may actually be pregnant, this raises immediate questions — mainly, who’s the father? Especially following Georgia’s emotionally charged moment with Joe (Raymond Ablack), her longtime confidant and the only man who truly gets the truth from the start.
“It’s going to get messy,” Howey teases. “And on this show, nothing is ever simple.”
With Paul out of the picture and Joe back in the orbit, a potential love triangle might just explode in Season 4.

Meanwhile, Ginny’s end to the season is more strategic — and dangerous. Ginny convinces her little brother, Austin, to lie under oath and say Austin’s abusive father, Gil, killed Tom. It’s the lie that sets Georgia free, but at a cost.
“She definitely manipulates him,” Gentry says. “It’s survival. She pulled a Georgia.”
Gentry explains that Ginny knew the longterm impact that lying under oath could have on her younger brother but felt she had no other choice.
“She forced his hand,” Gentry says. “She wasn’t going to let Austin live with that man, not while their mom rotted in jail.”
The scene leaves lingering questions, too: Is Ginny becoming her mother? What kind of damage has already been done to Austin, who ends the season acting withdrawn and unstable?
“That’s the scary part,” Gentry says. “(Austin) has already changed.”

By the finale’s end, Georgia is surrounded. Paul is gone. Cynthia is furious. Gil may retaliate. And her own parent and step-parent — who previously hurt her — are back and know where she lives. A baby on the way could be either a blessing or a time bomb.
When asked who might be the biggest threat next season, Gentry pauses. “Honestly? The danger might not come from one person,” she says. “It could be Georgia herself — or even Ginny.”
“There’s a little bit of villain and hero in everyone,” Howey adds.
And that’s exactly where “Ginny & Georgia” thrives: in the gray areas.
In the end, the final twist cements what we’ve known all along — Georgia doesn’t get happy endings. She gets complicated ones.

title: Longtime ‘Summer House’ Star Announces Departure: ‘You Haven’t See the Last of Me’
summary: Paige DeSorbo announced on Instagram she is exiting Bravo's "Summer House" after seven seasons on the reality show. She recently launched clothing line Daphne.
story: A popular "Summer House" star is bidding farewell to the Bravo reality series.
On June 5, Paige DeSorbo announced her departure from the show. The news comes just after Season Nine of "Summer House" wrapped up with the final portion of its two-part reunion June 4.
DeSorbo made the announcement on her Instagram story, teasing "a little life update" for her fans.

"I've made the decision not to return to Summer House. Being part of this show has been one of the most rewarding chapters of my life - the friendships, the drama, the giggles, all unforgettable. You've seen me grow up over these last 7 summers. I'll always be beyond grateful for the memories, the community, and the opportunities this wild ride has brought me," she captioned the post.
DeSorbo went on to say it is "time for this chapter to close" and thanked her fans and NBCUniversal family. She also shared some encouraging news for her followers.
"And you haven't seen the last of me, I promise," she wrote, vowing that there is still "so much more to do together."
Bravo also shared the news in an Instagram post, prompting many viewers to weigh in with their reactions in the comments.
"A star was born right before our eyes!!! Thanks for the giggles Paige ❤️," one wrote.
Many fans were saddened by the news, including one who penned the following reaction: "😢 I’ll miss Paige, she was always my favorite. Hope@she gets a spinoff in the city! 🤞🏻."
"Respectfully, this is devastating," another commented.
Still, many people sent messages of support for the reality star and wished her well in her future endeavors.
"Whatever she does she’s gonna win!!! Love this for her," one person commented.
"You’ll be missed! A fashion icon!" another wrote.
In recent months, DeSorbo has been embracing the single life after her breakup with Craig Conover from "Southern Charm."

After reading about DeSorbo's departure from "Summer House" on Bravo's Instagram page, many viewers noted that they were sad to see her go since they were hoping to watch her romantic antics unfold in a new season after the breakup.
"I was looking forward to watching a single summer for Paige," one fan wrote.

DeSorbo, who co-hosts the podcast “Giggly Squad” with Hannah Berner, another former "Summer House star, was known for her keen sense of style on the show and time spent in bed gabbing with her friends. She recently announced that she’s launching a sleepwear line called Daphne, which also happens to be the name of her beloved cat.

title: Tom Felton Returning As Draco Malfoy for ‘Harry Potter and the Cursed Child’ on Broadway: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Tom Felton is reprising his role as Draco Malfoy for Harry Potter and the Cursed Child on Broadway, he exclusively revealed on TODAY.
story: Tom Felton is reprising his role as Draco Malfoy — this time on Broadway.

The actor announced exclusively on TODAY that he will be returning as the beloved villain of the “Harry Potter” series in the Broadway production, “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child,” for 19 weeks starting in November.

“It’s very much a pinch-me situation,” Felton told Savannah Guthrie and Craig Melvin on June 5. “I keep thinking I’m dreaming. I let go of that character 16 years ago, and now I get to step back into his shoes, as a father this time, in a new story.”

Felton, 37, will become the first member of the original film cast to join the Broadway show, which takes place 19 years after the end of the original series, as Draco, Harry, Ron and Hermione are sending their own children off to Hogwarts.
“‘Potter’ was a massive chunk of my childhood, and now I get to sort of go back whilst also going forward,” Felton later told TODAY.com.

“The play is such an independent story from the ‘Potter’ films that I grew up with. We start 19 years later ... now we’re no longer children. We actually are the parents. So as much as it is reprising an old role for me, it’s very much treading into new, unfamiliar territory. I know him quite well as a kid. I don’t know him that well as an adult. So that’s the that’s the exciting challenge ahead for me.”
The reprisal of the role marks the first time Felton will portray Draco in nearly 15 years, and is also Felton’s Broadway debut.

“It’s very, very easy to get emotional,” Felton said. “When they put my blond wig on for the theater production, I just immediately cried. It was just sort of like a blast from the past. ... It was something that I never thought I’d see again.”

Felton is set to star in the show Nov. 11, 2025, to March 22, 2026, at the Lyric Theatre in New York City. Fans can sign up for first access to tickets which will unlock entry to a presale that begins on June 10 at 11 a.m. ET. Tickets will go on sale to the general public on June 12 at 11 a.m. ET.

“Harry Potter and the Cursed Child,” the highest-grossing non-musical play in Broadway history, has sold more than 10 million tickets worldwide since its premiere in London in 2016. It is the fourth longest-running Broadway play ever and has productions running currently in London, New York, Hamburg and Tokyo.

Sonia Friedman and Colin Callender, producers behind the Broadway production, said in a statement that they can’t wait to see Felton portray the role “once again with the same depth, gravity, and humanity he has always brought to Draco.”

“It’s not lost on us that this is a cultural moment charged with nostalgia, evolution, and emotion,” Friedman and Callender said. “Tom’s return to Hogwarts bridges generations of fans and breathes new life into a beloved story. We’re beyond thrilled to welcome Tom back ‘home’ but also into a new family: our Broadway company.”

A renewed “Harry Potter” craze is only beginning on Broadway, as HBO announced it would be adapting J.K. Rowling’s books into a television series earlier this year. After casting directors watched tens of thousands of children audition, Dominic McLaughlin, Arabella Stanton and Alastair Stout were chosen to play Harry Potter, Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley, respectively.

title: Shannon Reveals the 1 ‘Really Funny’ Off-Camera Moment Fans Didn’t See on ‘Bravo’s Love Hotel’
summary: "Real Housewives of Orange County" star Shannon Storms Beador talks in an interview with TODAY.com about "Bravo's Love Hotel" with Luann, Gizelle and Ashley.
story: Four ladies entered “Bravo’s Love Hotel” looking for love, and whether they were successful on that journey remains to be seen. But one of the women will at least walk away with a rather interesting piece of knowledge — thanks to two of her castmates.

Shannon Storms Beador, known for her time on “The Real Housewives of Orange County,” revealed a “really funny” exchange she shared with Gizelle Bryant and Ashley Darby (“The Real Housewives of Potomac”) when cameras were down.

“We were sitting there after the third group of men came in, and I wasn’t really interested in anyone, so I was sitting off (to the side), and I was with Gizelle and Ashley,” Shannon says during an interview with TODAY.com.
“And they said, ‘Have you ever had your back broke?’” she continues. “I go, ‘What is that?’ I go, ‘What is “back broke”?’”
She says Ashley and Gizelle started “walking funny” to demonstrate and explain to her the meaning of the phrase, used to describe feeling some type of way after a passionate night with someone.
“I was bummed they didn’t use that because it was really funny,” Shannon says with a smile.

Shannon says that she, Ashley, Gizelle and the fourth woman in the hotel, Luann de Lesseps (“The Real Housewives of New York City”), formed “a bond that will be there forever” while filming the dating show in Los Cabos, Mexico, where they were presented with a variety of suitors.
Shannon had previously crossed paths with Gizelle and Luann on an episode of “Project Runway” in 2022.
“I love Luann,” Shannon says, “I say she’s ‘a kick in the pants’ because she just — pure entertainment, super fun, but also just a very kind heart.”
She says each of the women has qualities that she wishes she had more of.
In one episode, Ashley comforted Shannon after she became emotional when she realized it had been exactly one year since she was arrested in her DUI case.
Shannon says she reached out to Ashley after the episode aired because her support “meant a lot.”
“She was actually going to get to know one of the men better, and instead sat with me knowing that I was upset,” she says.
Shannon also says she did not like that she ended up getting emotional on the show.
“I never thought that I would cry, darn it, but I did,” Shannon says. “Gizelle has this confidence and this strength, and they all do, actually. They’re all very confident.”

She describes the premise of the show as an “uncomfortable situation” for her because she had never asked a man out on a date or dated more than one person at the same time. The fallout of Shannon’s marriage played out across some of her early seasons of “RHOC,” as did her subsequent relationship with John Janssen, who got engaged to former cast member Alexis Bellino.
“It was nice for me to feel uncomfortable because I’m not used to that,” Shannon says.
On the show, she struck up a romance early on with a man named Earl, also known as “Earl the Pearl.”
“I didn’t think that I would meet someone where we have a true relationship, but it was surprising,” Shannon says with a laugh. “I did meet someone.”
She says after a “horrible year,” she “just vowed” that she was not going to date and would instead focus on herself. Then, she was asked to join the “Love Hotel.”
“I thought, ‘OK, this is enough time that I’ve been single,’” she says.
Men of all ages have tried to woo the ladies in the “Love Hotel,” and Shannon, 61, wants to make one thing clear about herself: “I am not a cougar,” she says.

“In fact, (production) asked me, ‘What’s your age range?’ And I said, ‘Fifty-eight to 63.’ They’re like, ‘Shannon, you need to expand that a little bit,’” she explains. “I’m not into going out with younger guys. So yeah, the pool was a little bit more limited for me. I was the oldest.”
Shannon acknowledges she is “a little buttoned up” and says all she needs in a partner is “basic manners.”
“When we had the formal dinner, only three people put their napkin on their lap,” she says.

“In my perfect world, I would meet someone who is confident, successful and thinks it’s really cute that I’m on this silly show and doesn’t want to be a part of it. Because that’s a really hard thing when you’ve been doing it for as long as we have, that, you know, does someone want to be famous or not?” Shannon says.
“That’s what happened in my last relationship,” she adds in an apparent reference to Janssen. “He wanted to be, and I didn’t think he did.”
“Bravo’s Love Hotel” airs Sundays at 9 p.m. ET on Bravo and streams the next day on Peacock.
(Bravo and Peacock are part of our parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: 'Love Island USA' Abruptly Announces Yulissa Escobar Exit from Show
summary: Yulissa Escobar's time was cut short on "Love Island USA." In Episode 2, the show abruptly announced that the Miami native has left the villa for good.
story: Yulissa Escobar will not be finding love on this season of "Love Island USA."
The contestant was removed from the villa during the second episode of Season 7 and little detail was given about her exit.
Right when the islanders were waking up in the morning, series narrator Iain Stirling announced that Escobar was no longer on the show.
"Welcome back to 'Love Island USA,'" he says in the episode. "Yulissa has left the villa." It is unclear when Escobar exited the villa and if she was also edited out of the show.
Her abrupt departure comes after she received online backlash following resurfaced clips of her using racist language, including the N-word, while discussing past relationships on a podcast.
Peacock confirmed to TODAY.com that Escobar is no longer a part of the show. The reality star has yet to publicly comment on her departure.
On social media, "Love Island USA" fans weighed in with some saying they were happy to see Escobar go.

"'Yulissa has left the villa.' and we all cheered," one person commented on a joint Instagram post that Escobar and "Love Island USA" shared of the 27-year-old showing off her personality on the program.
A third added, "Yall got rid of her QUICK! 😭😂."
Someone else said, "being kicked off day 2 is crazyyyy."
Meanwhile, other fans said they felt “robbed” for not getting the chance to vote her out.
"The fact that we didn’t even get the privilege to vote her off gets me mad but hey a win is a win 🤣 they really said y’all want her off you got it!," one fan wrote.
"We didn’t EVEN get the satisfaction of voting her off LMAOO," another added.

Escobar hails from Miami, Florida, and in a YouTube video that Peacock shared of the cast, she said that she was excited to be on the hit reality TV series after her previous relationship ended in heartbreak.
“I was in a nine year relationship. He left me. I’m glad he broke my heart because look at me here,” she said. “I want my man to nurture me.”

On the show, Escobar coupled up with 22-year-old Ace Green, even though he was already paired up with fellow contestant Chelley Bissainthe. This caused Chelley and Austin Shepard to couple up instead.
"I'm here to find my knight in shining armor. I want that movie kind of love," Escobar said in her cast video on Instagram.
"I could be fire, so don't play with fire because you might burned, baby," she added. "I'm here to have fun, to meet friends and enjoy summer in Fiji. We're in Fiji!"

title: ‘Ginny & Georgia’: All the People Georgia Has Killed — So Far
summary: Who has Georgia killed in ginny and Georgia/ Here is a full list of everyone she's killed so far.
story: By the end of Season 3 of "Ginny & Georgia," Georgia Miller’s carefully crafted image as a charming Southern mom has officially unraveled. Beneath the sunny smile and picture-perfect exterior is a woman who has killed three times.

Not every act was cold-blooded murder, but each one left a body behind. Georgia may have walked out of court a free woman, but her secrets are no longer buried. Her past, once guarded so fiercely, is now in full view.

“We’ve been calling this Georgia’s breakdown season,” actor Brianne Howey, who plays Georgia, tells TODAY.com. “Ginny had to go through it last season, and now it was Georgia’s turn. Georgia has to face these consequences, and yes, as an actor, it was devastating.”
“Georgia got very burned this season — but I’m hoping to see her rise from the ashes,” she says.
Here’s a breakdown of the lives Georgia has taken, her motivations and how those choices may continue to unravel in future seasons.
Tom Fuller (Season 2, Episode 10)

Georgia’s most controversial kill comes in the Season 2 finale, when she smothers Cynthia Fuller’s (Sabrina Grdevich) comatose husband, Tom (Vincent Legault), with a pillow. Cynthia never asked her to — but Georgia takes it upon herself.
It’s framed as a mercy killing, but it also conveniently removes an obstacle in Cynthia’s life — which benefits Georgia socially and emotionally.

“There haven’t, historically in her life, been a lot of people who have helped her, so that has so much weight to her,” series creator Sarah Lampert tells TODAY.com. “She really does see killing Cynthia’s husband, in her mind, as a favor. She views herself as judge, jury and executioner.”
Georgia feels indebted to Cynthia for helping her get rid of her abusive ex, Gil. Killing Tom is Georgia’s twisted way of repaying that kindness, actor Howey says.

“Georgia didn’t want anybody to know what her relationship with Gil was like,” Howey tells TODAY.com. “But Georgia doesn’t have a lot of friends. The act of kindness Cynthia offered her — by making sure Gil couldn’t live in town — was paramount for Georgia. Nothing had meant more to her.”

“So yes, Georgia can feel morally ambiguous,” she adds. “But Georgia feels that her intentions are pure. She wanted to give Cynthia the same favor Cynthia gave her — to remove the pain in her life. It’s very nuanced and complicated, but I think there’s a recognition between these two women about how hard it is to be a mom and a woman.”
Kenny Drexel (Season 1)
Kenny (Darryl Scheelar), Georgia’s wealthy second husband, dies under mysterious circumstances — until it’s revealed Georgia had poisoned his smoothie with wolfsbane.

Georgia later claims she did it to protect Ginny, after discovering Kenny had been sexually inappropriate toward her daughter. It’s the first clear sign that Georgia is willing to kill for her family — and to keep control of the narrative.

“Kenny was a bad guy,” Antonia Gentry, who plays Ginny, tells TODAY.com. “A lot of what happens to Ginny and Georgia happens simply because of the decisions they make. So maybe the bad guy at the end of the day is just their carelessness, their recklessness, their impulsivity.”
Anthony Green (Season 1, Flashback)

In a flashback from years earlier, Georgia’s abusive ex-husband, Anthony Green (Rodrigo Fernandez-Stoll), shows up, threatening both her and a young Ginny. Georgia shoots him, a death that’s arguably self-defense.
Still, she disposes of the body and never reports it. The moment shapes her view of justice: If the system won’t help her, she’ll take matters into her own hands.
“Georgia can feel morally ambiguous, but Georgia feels that her intentions are pure,” Howey says.
